Ivan Gazidis would love that Paolo Maldini and Ralf Rangnick work together. The Italian can get a new operational role in the club and would make some decisions with the German.

The CEO of Milan would also like to see a meeting between Stefano Pioli and Ralf Rangnick. Milan appreciates the work of the current coach and it cannot be ruled out that Italian will remain the Rossoneri coach and German will manage "only" the sports area for some time.

[Gianluca Di Marzio]

The arrival of Ralf Rangnick is a formality. The only thing missing is the signature of a 3-year contract and the communication from Milan. German should act as a coach and director of the sports area.

The employment of the German does not mean the departure of Paolo Maldini. The Italian may become the club's ambassador or vice president, but his role in the club would be more representative than operational. Maldini asked for time for reflection. The decision should be made in the coming days. Most likely, Maldini will not accept this offer and leave the club in the summer.

Almost certainly, Hendrik Almstadt and Geoffrey Moncada will become Ralf Rangnick's new collaborators in Milan. It cannot rule out staying Frederic Massara, whose future requires evaluation.

The arrival of Ralf Rangnick does not necessarily mean that Stefano Pioli will say goodbye to the club at the beginning of August. There is a hypothesis that Rangnick will hold managerial positions at the club for at least one season and Pioli may remain a Milan coach.

[La Gazzetta dello Sport]
